greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: The eventual period of the RATS sequence in base n starting from 1; 0 is for infinity.
comment: Eventual period of 1 under the mapping x->A288535(n,x), or 0 if there is a divergence and thus no eventual period.
In Thiel's terms, the zeroes a(10), a(19), and a(37) correspond to quasiperiodic divergent RATS sequences with quasiperiod 2, while a(50)=0 corresponds to a sequence with quasiperiod 3.
link: S. Shattuck and C. Cooper, Divergent RATS sequences, Fibonacci Quart., 39 (2001), 101-106.
J. Thiel, On RATS sequences in general bases, Integers, 14 (2014), #A50.
Index entries for sequences related to RATS: Reverse, Add Then Sort
example: In base 3, the RATS mapping acts as 1 -> 2 -> 4 (11 in base 3) -> 8 (22 in base 3) -> 13 (112 in base 3) -> 4, which has already been seen 3 steps ago, so a(3)=3.
results.author: _Andrey Zabolotskiy_, Jun 11 2017
